intro: Euphrasia gonzaloi, commonly known as the González's eyebright, is a species of flowering plant native to the high Andes of Peru. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many herbs with medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy, succulent leaves adapted to its harsh, high-altitude environment. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
